description:
The **AWSSupport-TroubleshootElasticBeanstalk** runbook is designed to help diagnose and resolve issues causing your AWS Elastic Beanstalk environment to enter a Degraded or Severe state. This automation examines critical resources and configurations associated with your Elastic Beanstalk environment, including:

> **Infrastructure Configuration**:
>   - Load balancer settings.
>   - AWS CloudFormation stack details.
>   - Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group configuration.
>   - Amazon EC2 instance health and settings.
>   - Virtual private cloud (VPC) configurations.
>
>**Network Diagnostics**:
>   - Security group rules, route tables, and network access control lists (ACLs) tied to your subnets.
>   - Connectivity to Elastic Beanstalk endpoints and public internet access.
>
>**Component Status Checks**:
>   - Verifies the operational state of the load balancer.
>   - Checks the health and status of Amazon EC2 instances.
>
>**Log Analysis:**
>   - Collects a comprehensive log bundle from your Elastic Beanstalk environment.
>   - Optionally uploads the logs to AWS Support for further analysis.

This runbook provides a structured approach to identifying potential issues and ensuring the stability and performance of your Elastic Beanstalk environment.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Optional) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows Systems Manager Automation to perform the actions on your behalf. If no role is specified, Systems Manager Automation uses the permissions of the user that starts this runbook.

ApplicationName.description: (Required) The name of your Elastic Beanstalk application.

EnvironmentName.description: (Required) The name of your Elastic Beanstalk environment.

AWSS3UploaderLink.description: (Optional) An URL provided to you by AWS Support to upload the log bundle from your Elastic Beanstalk environment to the AWS Support S3 Uploader. This option is only available to customers who have purchased an AWS Support plan, and have opened a Support case. Please make sure you are not sending any sensitive data, including access credentials and data bound by special requirements or regulations.

mainSteps.name: IAMPermissionsCheck
mainSteps.description: Verifies if the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) principal who started the automation has the required permissions to perform all of the actions defined in the runbook.

mainSteps.name: BranchOnProceedOnlyIfUserHasPermission
mainSteps.description: Proceeds with the tests execution if the principal running the automation has all the required permissions or generates a report, if not.

mainSteps.name: GetEnvironmentDetails
mainSteps.description: Collects information about the Elastic Beanstalk environment including the load balancer, AWS CloudFormation stack, Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group, Amazon EC2 instances, and Amazon VPC configuration.

mainSteps.name: CheckVPCSubnets
mainSteps.description: Checks the routing tables and the network ACLs associated with the subnets in your Amazon VPC for network connectivity issues.

mainSteps.name: CheckSecurityGroups
mainSteps.description: Checks the security group rules associated with your Amazon EC2 instances for network connectivity issues.

mainSteps.name: CheckEc2Health
mainSteps.description: Verifies the status checks for the Amazon EC2 instances.

mainSteps.name: CollectLogsLink
mainSteps.description: Generates a link for a log bundle of your Elastic Beanstalk environment.

mainSteps.name: UploadLogs
mainSteps.description: Uploads the log bundle to AWS Support.

mainSteps.name: GenerateReport
mainSteps.description: Generates a report of action items to assist the troubleshooting of the impaired Elastic Beanstalk environment.
